Data: Broad to Paine, no run good length outside off, climbing through to the keeper. No stroke
Broad to Paine, no run fuller and attacking the top of off. Dabbed into the leg side and they scamper through
Broad to Paine, 1 run overpitched a fraction outside off, pushed into the covers and they turn down a risky two. Ponting glares at Paine for a hesitant call
Broad to Ponting, no run back and across, and defended to midwicket
Broad to Ponting, 1 wide oops, that's a bit misdirected. Wa-ay down the leg side
Broad to Ponting, no run outside off this time, Ponting unfurls his best Test-match leave-alone to usher that one through. Bat high, front knee bent, you know the drill
Broad to Ponting, FOUR runs cracking strike to finish the over, just enough width and Ponting leathers it off the back foot, through the covers. No stopping that
Bresnan to Paine, no run drawn forward, and deflected down to gully. Good line
Bresnan to Paine, 3 runs chipped in the air and through the gap at midwicket. A touch lucky, maybe? I suppose he found the gap well enough
Bresnan to Ponting, no run punched into the covers off the back foot this time
Bresnan to Ponting, no run Bresnan goes wide of the crease and draws a straight-batted defence in front of middle and off
Bresnan to Ponting, FOUR runs sublime. There's no stopping that. Eases into a flicked on-drive as Bresnan strays a touch. He's ticking now
Bresnan to Ponting, no run what on earth was that? A filthy flat-footed mow, just as I was singing his stylish praises. No contact, and for Ponting's sake, that's just as well
Broad to Paine, 1 run tucked off the hip to midwicket
Broad to Ponting, no run fuller and straighter, Ponting defends
Broad to Ponting, no run worked to midwicket but can't pick the gap
Broad to Ponting, no run slower ball, tossed up a touch, met on the half-volley and eased to mid-on
Broad to Ponting, no run jabbed to gully
Broad to Ponting, no run pushed firmly into the covers, can't beat the field
Anderson to Paine, no run outside off, a hint of late movement, no stroke offered
Anderson to Paine, 1 run flicked off the pads, down to fine leg
Anderson to Ponting, no run tight line from Anderson, Ponting bides his time
Anderson to Ponting, no run tucked up by a hint of movement back off the track.
Anderson to Ponting, 1 run swished off the pads, French-cricket style. Effective enough
Anderson to Paine, no run attempted late steer through point, but can't get the angle. Good over for England's purposes
Broad to Ponting, 1 run clipped up and out to square leg.
Broad to Paine, no run snorter! That one utterly flew off a good length. Paine whips his gloves, neck, bat, everything, inside the line
Broad to Paine, no run another short ball, Paine turns turtle, as Ponting pats his bat in approval
Broad to Paine, no run stands tall this time to defend from back in the crease
Broad to Paine, no run more aggression from Broad. A feisty over
Broad to Paine, no run pushed back onto the stumps, and England have strung together a good sequence of overs to stifle Australia's intent for the moment
Anderson to Ponting, 1 run speared into the pads, flicked out to square leg
Anderson to Paine, no run zips off the deck, raps the pads, always going high, but a lively delivery all the same
Anderson to Paine, no run poked back to the bowler, good areas Jimmy
Anderson to Paine, 1 run worked out to deep midwicket, Bell jogs round to field.
Anderson to Ponting, no run drawn forward on a good length, pushed into the covers
Anderson to Ponting, FOUR runs down the track from Ponting, to marvellous effect. That fairly whistled back past the bowler, all along the ground. Top batting
Broad to Paine, no run pushed out to cover
Broad to Paine, no run this one climbs and zips back into the batsman. Good bowling
Broad to Paine, no run testing times for Paine. The back-of-a-length tactics are cramping his style
Broad to Paine, 1 run short again and pulled, without much conviction. Fine leg fields on the bounce
Broad to Ponting, no run solidly forward, pushed up to cover

Broad to Ponting, OUT short again, and that's the big breakthrough that England needed! An attempted pull, but Ponting muffs his signature stroke, and lobs a simple chance almost off the back of his bat, straight through to Kieswetter!
Wright to Paine, 1 run solidly forward, punched to cover
Wright to White, no run good length, a fraction too wide, but left safely alone
Wright to White, FOUR runs over-pitched, and eased through the covers. That's a calm stroke, and mightily effective
Wright to White, 1 run too short, and pulled urgently, but without much timing to square leg
Wright to Paine, 1 run angled into the pads, worked square once again
Wright to White, 1 run a hint of width, and jabbed to third man
Broad to White, no run up onto the toes, and tucked to midwicket
Broad to White, 1 run banged into the track, slightly back of a length, nurdled to third man
Broad to Paine, 1 run whoops, Collingwood nutmegs himself at point, and gifts an extra run. A rare lapse
Broad to White, 1 run dabbed down to third man
Broad to Paine, FOUR runs banged in short, and smacked hard through backward square. In the air, but excellently placesd
Broad to Paine, 1 run makes room outside off, but an ambitious wipe doesn't quite come off
Wright to Paine, no run gives himself room by backing away to leg, but a well-timed drive picks out mid-off
Wright to Paine, no run short, and that one appears to chase the batsman as he withdraws his bat. Does well in the end
Wright to Paine, 1 run pitched up to the toes, clipped coolly to midwicket
Wright to White, no run straightens a touch from leg to off. Well watched, and defended on the line of middle
Wright to White, 1 run jabbed down through gully with an open face
Wright to Paine, 1 run quick single to midwicket. Australia keep ticking over
Broad to Paine, no run banged in short, no stroke offered there
Broad to Paine, no run short again, climbing and following Paine as he attempted a steer to third man. Nearly got in a massive tangle there
Broad to Paine, no run clever bowling. The slower ball, juicily served up on a full length outside off. Paine's eyes light up, and he all but chops onto his stumps
Broad to Paine, no run forward and defended again to cover
Broad to Paine, 1 run that's a grim shot from Paine. Short, but not terrifyingly so. He completely averts his gaze and splices a leading edge into space in the gully. Lucky to survive
Broad to White, no run banged in short again, White hops into a clip off the toes
Wright to Paine, no run defended down into the crease.
Wright to Paine, 1 run open-faced steer to third man
Wright to White, no run defended on the line of off stump
Wright to White, 1 run worked off the toes, out to midwicket
Wright to Paine, no run short again, and Paine pulls without conviction. Midwicket fields
Wright to Paine, no run up onto the toes, but there's no width to work with. Point tidies up an attempted late cut. And Paine is visible frustrated.
Yardy to White, no run good length, outside off. Pushed back to the bowler
Yardy to White, no run familiarly wide of the crease. White can't work with the angle
Yardy to White, no run blocked into the off side
Yardy to White, 1 run tucked off the pads
Yardy to Paine, no run tossed up, and swished to midwicket
Yardy to Paine, no run extravagently wide of the return crease - that's encroaching on no-ball territory. But the upshot is a very tidy over indeed
Wright to White, no run poked out to cover
Wright to White, no run driven off the back foot, Wright stoops in his followthrough, and intercepts
Wright to White, no run tidy line and length, nothing to work with there
Wright to White, 1 run flicked off the toes to backward square
Wright to Paine, 3 runs Paine decides to up the ante. Short again, but this time he climbs into a premeditated tennis smash. Good aggression, trying to break the shackles
Wright to White, 1 run worked out to the off side, White snaffles the strike
Yardy to White, no run massive appeal as White misses an attempted sweep. Outside the line
Yardy to White, 1 run jabbed into the off side
Yardy to Paine, FOUR runs reverse sweep and excellently executed
Yardy to Paine, no run wide of the crease once again, the angle is effective
Yardy to Paine, no run
Yardy to Paine, 1 run punched into the covers and they amble a single
Wright to Paine, 1 run Wright bustles up another on off stump, carefully pushed in to the off side
Wright to White, FOUR runs short ball here, White whirls away a pull shot that flies off the top edge, sailing comfortably into a gap at fine leg for four
Wright to White, no run altogether more careful here, fully behind a defensive block
Wright to White, 1 run decent line from Wright, not much movement now for him though, and it's pushed to deep point

Wright to Paine, 2 runs played with very soft hands by Paine, defending and it came off the outside edge, ran down to third man where Broad slides well to field, and somehow keep it to two, should have been a third there
Wright to Paine, 1 run Paine opens the face and guides it more certainly down to third man again
Yardy to Paine, FOUR runs that'll do nicely for Paine, neat cut shot, off the back foot, beating short third man and running away for four to bring up a fifty
Yardy to Paine, 1 run he looks a much happier character now, but will need to accelerate as the innings goes on, this is useful, working it to midwicket for one
Yardy to White, no run White aims a big heave-ho at Yardy, but clumps nothing but thin air as Yardy fired it through
Yardy to White, no run nothing expansive here, just quiet defence
Yardy to White, 1 run something verging on delicacy from White here, dabbing to point for one
Yardy to Paine, no run Paine inside-edges a defensive shot to end the over
Swann to White, no run starts tidily, bit of flight, White forward and blocking

Swann to White, OUT Swann does it again! The first-over demon strikes! White was looking to give himself room, Swann threw it wider and slower and White ended up dragging it without any timing down to Yardy, in from the long off boundary
Swann to Paine, no run beaten! Just went on with the arm and sneaked past the outside edge
Swann to Paine, 1 run well, Paine didn't quite pull this off, but the reverse-sweep gets a single off the bottom edge
Swann to Marsh, no run Marsh defends his first ball quietly enough, but there is a slip in place
Swann to Marsh, no run well, this is why there is a slip! Pitches and rips past the left hander's edge. Top bowling
Yardy to Paine, no run Yardy building good pressure with his darts, Paine defending hurriedly off the back foot
Yardy to Paine, no run this time Paine is forward, but there is still no run
Yardy to Paine, no run Paine tries to manufacture something, giving himself some room, but before he can do anything the ball is on him and he can't time it
Yardy to Paine, no run this time it's a more conventional dot ball, blocked away
Yardy to Paine, 1 run better from Paine, skipping down the wicket and milking a single down to long on
Yardy to Marsh, no run not sure how they didn't take a single here, Marsh pushed it into a gap at point and set off, Paine couldn't quite decide what to do and eventually sent Marsh back
Swann to Paine, no run nicely done from Swann, slow and flighted and Paine is forward and defending
Swann to Paine, no run Paine can't quite work the singles here, instead picking midwicket with a leg-side clip

Swann to Paine, OUT oh dear, this is ugly. Pain gets in a horrible tangle, aiming an expansive reverse-sweep to a flighted ball outside off, it pitched and turned back, spinning into a flurry of gloves and bat and cannoning on to the stumps
Swann to Hussey, no run defends his first ball carefully enough, looking busy as ever
Swann to Hussey, no run Hussey forward again, patting towards cover
Swann to Hussey, 1 run Hussey is off, cutting towards point and bustling through for a single
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run Yardy over the wicket, spearing this into Hussey, who happily works it to point for a single
Yardy to Marsh, 1 run Marsh turns this with the angle round the corner for a single
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run Australia already look more busy with Hussey at the crease, working another single to square leg
Yardy to Marsh, 1 run Yardy back round the wicket, makes little difference though as Marsh clips him usefully through midwicket for a single
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run nicely done by Hussey, dropping a forward defence into the off side and scampering through for a single
Yardy to Marsh, no run dot ball to finish as Marsh taps it down to the bowler
Swann to Hussey, no run Swann might have got away with this, touch short and wide, but Hussey picks out point
Swann to Hussey, 1 run this time Hussey gets a single, working it in front of point for a single
Swann to Marsh, no run Marsh leans into a forward defensive shot
Swann to Marsh, no run quietly defended once more
Swann to Marsh, no run Marsh stretches forward and leans a full-faced defensive to the covers
Swann to Marsh, 1 run oops, a single here for Marsh, but not how he intended, getting a leading edge into the covers as he tried to turn it into the leg side
PD Collingwood to Marsh, no run wow, this is slow, an off-cutter I suppose, Marsh taps it back to the bowler
PD Collingwood to Marsh, 1 run possibly even slower, but accurate and Marsh collects a very easy single, pushing into the covers
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run with the field set deep this should be middle-over milking, and Hussey does exactly that, chipping it through square leg for one
PD Collingwood to Marsh, 1 run Marsh this time knocks it into a gap at square leg for another gentle single
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run on and around off stump, Hussey pushes towards extra cover and helps himself to a single
PD Collingwood to Marsh, no run slightly fuller, Marsh blocks firmly to cover
Swann to Hussey, 1 run shouldn't have been a single there, pushed to mid on for one
Swann to Marsh, no run no single here, just full-faced to short-extra cover
Swann to Marsh, 1 run this time Marsh does collect the single, pushing it to point
Swann to Hussey, 1 run another single, nicely pushed for a single towards cover
Swann to Marsh, 1 leg bye Marsh works it into the leg side and collects one
Swann to Hussey, 1 run another single, very simple stuff, worked into the leg side
Bresnan to Hussey, no run starts very tidily, on a length on off stump and defended
Bresnan to Hussey, no run back of a length this time, Hussey hops into a defensive block, thought about stealing a single, but it's not there
Bresnan to Hussey, no run Bresnan has bowled very well today, and finds some away movement off the pitch, zipping past Hussey's outside edge
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run touch shorter, Hussey back and pulling in a flash, doesn't really time it perfectly but an easy single to deep midwicket
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run help-your-self single here, England just allowing these two to set a platform, Marsh dabs into space at midwicket and collects one
Bresnan to Hussey, no run back of a length this time, Hussey hurries into a back-foot block
Swann to Marsh, 3 runs confidently played by Marsh, getting down on one knee and sweeping firmly, some good running allows three, much to Swann's disgust
Swann to Hussey, no run good stuff here, nicely bowled, flighted and drifting, Hussey's drive was crisp, and Collingwood's fielding at short extra sharp
Swann to Hussey, no run bit of shout here from Swann as Hussey defends with bat and pad
Swann to Hussey, no run Hussey tries to work this round the corner and can't
Swann to Hussey, 1 run this time the single is earned, pushing past the bowler for one
Swann to Marsh, 1 run seemed very simple there for Marsh, leant forward, allowed the ball to hit the bat, and ran a single
Bresnan to Marsh, no run Bresnan continues to probe around off stump, Marsh can do nothing but defend
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 wide bit short from Bresnan, in fact, very shot, and wide enough for the umpire to give it a wide
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run back on a decent length and line, Marsh bunts it into the leg side and collects a single
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run lucky that for Hussey, he skipped down the wicket, Bresnan banged it in short, so Hussey delicately helped a pull shot in the air, one-bounce to deep midwicket
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run Marsh this time pulls, with better timing, but for only a single to midwicket
Bresnan to Hussey, 2 runs Hussey collects a couple, chopping into the leg side
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run cut away for a strike-stealing single
Swann to Hussey, 1 run Hussey collects another single, pushing towards long on
Swann to Marsh, no run nothing here for Marsh as he blocks back to the bowler
Swann to Marsh, 1 run Marsh on the sweep, he plays the shot well, firmly down to fine leg
Swann to Hussey, 1 run Hussey plays this from the crease, into point and gets a single
Swann to Marsh, 1 run well, single eventually, Marsh pushed it to point, didn't want a single, Hussey had come a long way down but Swann missed the throw and they collected one
Swann to Hussey, 1 run another single to finish, still quite quiet from Australia
Wright to Hussey, 2 runs bustles in and dishes up a half-tracker which Hussey pulls firmly in front of midwicket for a couple
Wright to Hussey, 2 runs nicely done by Hussey, working it with soft hands towards square leg, gently enough to collect a couple
Wright to Hussey, 1 run busy is what Hussey always is, and here he pushes to mid off and runs through for a single
Wright to Marsh, no run Marsh is not quite as fluent at working singles and picks out point with his back-foot block
Wright to Marsh, no run touch short from Wright but Marsh cuts straight to point again
Wright to Marsh, no run well, good second half to the over from Wright, Marsh fails to get a leg-side work away
Broad to Hussey, 2 runs Hussey begins the Powerplay with a crisp drive, so perfectly straight that it cannoned into the stumps at the bowler's end and ran away for a couple
Broad to Hussey, 1 run close here, Hussey pushed to extra cover and ran, Collingwood's throw missed the stumps
Broad to Marsh, 2 leg byes Broad might be a touch fortunate here, it was down the leg side and but Marsh couldn't quite work it fine for four, instead collecting a couple to fine leg
Broad to Marsh, no run short ball here, Marsh aims a big pull shot, but misses
Broad to Marsh, FOUR runs that'll do for Marsh, shot ball finds the glove, but it loops over Kieswetter for four
Broad to Marsh, SIX runs bang! He got all of that one though! Short and the pull shot was nailed over midwicket, scattering the crowd
Anderson to Hussey, 1 run good delivery, yorker length, squeezed back past the bowler
Anderson to Marsh, FOUR runs misdirected, and that's a poor follow-up. Leg-side full-toss, helped through the gap
Anderson to Marsh, FOUR runs bad bowling again from Anderson, but Marsh cashes in to full effect. On the pads, tucked fine
Anderson to Marsh, 1 run
Anderson to Hussey, no run dug out full, into the leg-side
Anderson to Hussey, 2 runs chipped out to square leg, the runs are flowing nicely now
Broad to Marsh, 2 runs width outside off stump, driven into the gap at cover
Broad to Marsh, 1 wide that's awful. Misses the cut strip
Broad to Marsh, 1 run clunked out to deep point
Broad to Hussey, 1 run this is well outside off stump again, Hussey bunts a single to point
Broad to Marsh, no run good bowling from Broad, much better, full and straight, Marsh blocked it back to the bowler
Broad to Marsh, SIX runs lovely shot, top stuff. Marsh took a single step forward, eased his arms through the line and pinged the ball straighter over the bowler's head for six
Broad to Marsh, FOUR runs four more! Marsh is playing a blinder, it was full outside off and he sliced it past point for another boundary
Swann to Hussey, FOUR runs oh dear, with that field looping outside off stump doesn't make sense, Hussey drives powerfully past cover for four
Swann to Hussey, 1 run good ball this, much better, quicker and angling in, clipped the pad first and Swann appealed, not out but replays suggest it was very close
Swann to Marsh, 1 run Marsh up the wicket, pushes into the off side and collects one
Swann to Hussey, 2 runs very nicely done from Hussey, feathered into the midwicket area, softly enough for two
Swann to Hussey, 1 run this time it's a single, dabbed behind square on the off side
Swann to Marsh, 1 run another single to finish up, tapped into space behind point
Anderson to Marsh, no run good from Anderson, full, straight and defended
Anderson to Marsh, 1 run fifty for Marsh, and how well he's played. First game back and he's picked up his seventh ODI fifty off 45 balls, clipping to deep midwicket
Anderson to Hussey, 1 wide can't bowl there, down the leg side and an extra run and extra ball
Anderson to Hussey, 1 run that's better, full and drilled to mid off for a swift single
Anderson to Marsh, no run nicely done from Anderson, he's landed the yorkers well this over, dug out by Marsh
Anderson to Marsh, SIX runs oops, he hasn't landed that yorker at all! Full toss and Marsh slapped it cleanly, over long on for six
Anderson to Marsh, 2 runs yorker again here, and Marsh jabs a single down the ground
Swann to Hussey, 1 run Swann lands this short and it's cut to deep point for one
Swann to Marsh, 1 run Marsh waits on the crease, pushes quietly into the off side and takes one
Swann to Hussey, no run nothing here for Hussey, timing it too well to extra cover
Swann to Hussey, 1 run Hussey on the sweep and playing it well down to midwicket

Swann to Marsh, OUT gone this time, Swann does the trick. Marsh tried to smash this inside-out over deep cover, Swann threw it wider and Marsh couldn't get the distance, Morgan ran around from long off to take the catch. Brings the end to an
Swann to Hussey, 1 run Hussey drops by his feet into the off side and scampers through for one
Bresnan to Hussey, FOUR runs this is not very good though, fine leg up and Bresnan goes full on leg stump, Hussey flicks it round the corner for four
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run this time it's a better length and Hussey clips through midwicket for a single
Bresnan to Smith, 1 run Bresnan angles it in from wide of the crease, Smith works it to square leg and it's another single
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run Bresnan is very lucky to get away with this, full toss well outside off, should have been four, but Hussey picked out deep point
Bresnan to Smith, 2 runs Smith is shuffling around the crease and Bresnan aims it down the leg side, Smith plays it gently enough to run two
Bresnan to Smith, 1 run touch shorter and guided to short third man for a swift single
Anderson to Smith, 1 run Anderson's return is greeted with with a heave that was mistimed to midwicket
Anderson to Hussey, 1 run fired down the leg side, Hussey clips it through to fine leg to bring up his run-a-ball fifty
Anderson to Smith, no run Smith hasn't quite found his range yet, clearing his front leg and aiming a big drive, but mistiming to mid off
Anderson to Smith, FOUR runs repeats the shot but this time plays it perfectly, timing it sweetly through extra cover for four
Anderson to Smith, 1 run again Smith hurls is front leg out the way, but this time goes leg side for a single
Anderson to Hussey, SIX runs Hussey is a dangerous man to finish the innings, really, and here he's picked up a full ball and deposited it miles over midwicket for six!
Bresnan to Smith, 1 run Smith again aims his inside-out shot, but finds mid off
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run well, Hussey's bat has exploded! He jabbed it out with the toe end and a massive chunk snapped off
Bresnan to Smith, 1 run it's not all that pretty from Smith, but very effective, he squats down low and tennis-swishes a slog to mid on
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run Hussey looking for another big leg-side pick-up, but it's a touch too short so he can only find a single to deep long on
Bresnan to Smith, 1 run Smith is an awkward fellow to bowl at, and here he's connected very firmly with a reverse pull
Bresnan to Hussey, SIX runs don't bowl there, not to Hussey, not now! Full toss on leg stump, Hussey smashes it over midwicket for six more
Anderson to Smith, 1 run for all his shuffling and awkward positions that Smith gets into, he does seem a very natural timer, after a flurry of movement he guides this sweetly to deep cover
Anderson to Hussey, FOUR runs talking about good timing, how about this! Hussey gives himself a fraction of room and carefully eases a drive over cover for four
Anderson to Hussey, FOUR runs brilliant batting, really top stuff, Hussey clips it into a gap at square leg for four more. Anderson really suffering here
Anderson to Hussey, 1 run much better from Anderson, landing the yorker that Hussey digs out
Anderson to Smith, 1 run full toss outside off but Smith had decided to go leg-side quite early, so can't quite time it as it heads down to midwicket
Anderson to Hussey, FOUR runs startling stuff from Hussey, gets down on one knee and dinks it to fine leg for another boundary
Broad to Smith, OUT some joy here for England, Smith forehand-slaps a short ball but straight down to Anderson at long off
Broad to Hussey, 2 runs very good running from Hussey, how he's collected two I don't know, he drilled it down the ground and scampered two
Broad to Hussey, OUT gone this time! Broad gets another, Hussey slicing a drive down to long off, but it has been a superb innings, completely flipped this game on its head
Broad to Hopes, SIX runs well, Hopes has done this brilliantly, touch short and a touch wide, but the upper cut has flown for six over deep cover
Broad to Hopes, FOUR runs Hopes is playing a two-ball blinder! Slower ball bouncer and he waited and waited before slamming it wide of Anderson at long on for four
Broad to Hopes, 2 runs two more to finish and what an end that has been for Australia. 130 has come from the last 11 overs
Brydon Coverdale has furiously typed out his bulletin to tell you more, so check that out.

Brilliant finish, Australia were completely stuck until Hussey and Marsh took the Powerplay in the 39th over. Suddenly they found their range and England panicked. It was breathless stuff and it's set up what should be an enthralling run chase.
Here's Shaun Tait to open
Hello folks, the players are back out in the middle and we're all set for what should be a cracking chase. I'm Liam Brickhill, and Sahil Dutta and I will be your commentators for the second innings.
Tait to Strauss, no run Tait starts with a loosener... that spits up savagely off a length outside off at more than 90mph. Strauss drops the hands and gets out of the way of that thunderbolt
Tait to Strauss, 1 wide very quick again, but misdirected down the leg side this time and called wide
Tait to Strauss, 1 leg bye Strauss didn't quite pick this one up, but he takes it on the thigh pad and Kieswetter calls him through for a quick single
Tait to Kieswetter, no run absolute gem from Tait! Sharp swing away from the bat, late and at high pace. Kieswetter pushes at it, but that was too good to even get an edge on
Tait to Kieswetter, no run beaten again! Slightly fuller this time, but the swing is there again and the ball zips past the outside edge
Tait to Kieswetter, 1 run back of a length this time, Kieswetter gets into some difficulty as he fends to leg, the ball pops up but falls safely
Tait to Strauss, no run full and swinging, but Strauss presents the full face of the bat to defend
Bollinger to Kieswetter, no run good start, outside off and there's a touch of swing back in to Kieswetter, though it's wide enough to leave alone
Bollinger to Kieswetter, no run tapped defensively back down the wicket off the back foot
Bollinger to Kieswetter, 1 run too straight, and the swing in to the right-hander takes it towards leg stump. Kieswetter nudges to midwicket and they set off immediately

Bollinger to Strauss, 1 wide short and wide outside off, you'd back Strauss to cash in on those every time but some extra bounce and movement away from him means the ball loops past the edge. Too far outside off, that's a wide
Bollinger to Strauss, no run big swing from Bollinger! Strauss is drawn forward into an optimistic drive but massive, hooping movement away from him means he misses by a good few inches
Bollinger to Strauss, no run he's expecting it to move now, and as Bollinger sends one down on a length outside off Strauss just pulls the bat inside the line
Bollinger to Strauss, no run beaten on the outside edge! In the channel outside off, close enough that Strauss had to play this time, but the movement takes the ball past the edge.
Tait to Kieswetter, no run full, fast and swinging, but Kieswetter drives nicely to mid-off. Beaten for pace though, he only moved forward after the shot had already been played
Tait to Kieswetter, 2 runs banged in short, ball hits bat as Kieswetter tries to hook but luckily for him it loops safely behind square leg
Tait to Kieswetter, no run full again, punched to cover
Tait to Kieswetter, 1 run nicely played by Kieswetter, the ball shaped away from him off a length but he got on top of it for a single to third man
Tait to Strauss, 2 runs Strauss shuffles right across to off stump and clips Tait down to fine leg. The pace on the ball means the fielder has to pull out the dive to cut it off
Tait to Strauss, no run feisty! Well-directed bouncer on middle and off, Strauss buckles the knees to get underneath it. Phew! That's nasty
Harris to Kieswetter, no run Kieswetter has a huge swipe to the first ball, which is full outside off, and misses completely
Harris to Kieswetter, no run now he's hit one! Middles a drive, but straight to cover. Sharp fielding there, it was really well struck
Harris to Kieswetter, no run squirted defensively to gully off the front foot

Harris to Kieswetter, no run after swinging a couple away from the bat, he gets one to jag in off the seam. Kieswetter is hurried in defence, and the ball shoots off the inner half of the bat to midwicket
Harris to Kieswetter, no run solid defensive stroke to backward point. That hit the middle, nice crack of bat on ball

Tait to Strauss, FOUR runs short and sharp from Tait, but he's offered width outside off and Strauss uppercuts down to third man. Such was the pace on the ball, it landed just inside the boundary rope!
Tait to Strauss, no run slower ball, but slips out a full toss outside off and Strauss taps to mid-off

Tait to Strauss, OUT clatter! That's the dismissal every fast bowler wants to see! Tait fires one in on a length, gets some nice shape in to the left-hander to beat his defensive poke and smash into the top of the off stump. That's a real sta

Tait to Yardy, 4 byes cuts him in half! I don't think Yardy even saw that, it was right through him before he could even get the bat down. Paine is done by the speed too, and that runs down to fine leg!
Tait to Yardy, 1 wide speared down the leg side, that's a wide. So Yardy will have to face up to that delivery again...

Tait to Yardy, OUT nope. I don't know what the thinking was sending Yardy in to face Tait, but it really hasn't worked. Tait fires one in fuller and Yardy simply leaves it - I don't think he quite picked the ball up - and the ball smashes int
Tait to PD Collingwood, 3 runs woah! Full and fast, Colly jams the bat down just in time to keep the ball out, and sends the ball into the gap on the leg side
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run full and wide outside off, swinging away and left alone by Collingwood
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood pushes leaden-footed at a length delivery outside off and is well beaten
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run and again, Harris shapes the ball away to beat the edge of Collingwood's prod. To the batsman's credit, he didn't push at the ball, just played the line

Harris to PD Collingwood, 3 runs too straight from Harris, and Collingwood nurdles one right out of the middle down to the midwicket boundary. Long boundary there, so a tough chase for the fielder, who does eventually haul it in
Harris to Kieswetter, no run quick yorker from Harris, Kieswetter does well to keep it out
Harris to Kieswetter, no run banged in outside off, Kieswetter whips his bat out of the way and leaves well alone
Tait to PD Collingwood, 2 runs on a length, but just too straight and Collingwood goes back and across, very deep in the crease, to work the ball away behind square on the leg side
Tait to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs even at Tait's pace, you can't afford to dish up a delivery like that. Ful and wide, and slapped past backward point for four

Tait to PD Collingwood, SIX runs pulled infront of square for six! That was anything but a nurdle, Tait drops short and Collingwood just rocks back and scythes through the line to send the ball sailing over the boundary
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run fuller this time, and the ball is met with the full face of the bat in a defensive stroke
Tait to PD Collingwood, 1 wide Collingwood shuffles across to off as Tait hurls one down the leg side - that's a wide
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run full and straight, pushed to mid on
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run inside edge squirts just past the stumps and straight to the man at short fine leg! That was mighty close, but no harm done in the end
Harris to Kieswetter, no run full and punched firmly into the covers
Harris to Kieswetter, no run just back of a length on off stump, Kieswetter gets on top of the ball and taps to point. Played it right under his eyes

Harris to Kieswetter, FOUR runs wonderful shot from Kieswetter, textbook cover drive played on the up through cover. Not a half-volley, but cracked right out of the middle with a high left elbow, and he picks the gap perfectly too
Harris to Kieswetter, 2 runs too straight to follow up, and he's flicked down to fine leg where a tumbling stop saves a few runs

Harris to Kieswetter, OUT leading edge flies to Hussey at extra cover, and Kieswetter departs! Harris had been shaping the ball away from him nicely, and as Kieswetter shaped to clip through midwicket the movement got him into trouble. The ba
Harris to Morgan, no run full to start, and Morgan taps the ball back to Harris
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run nice start, Bollinger finds some lift outside off to strike the splice of Collingwood's bat
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run same again, although this time Collingwood was expecting the extra bounce and got up on his toes to play the ball down to point

Bollinger to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs Bollinger directs one at leg stump and Collingwood rolls his wrists nicely over the ball to send it to the long leg boundary. Nice shot, didn't hit it too hard but got the timing and placement spot on
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run landing just outside off from over the wicket, and Collingwood leaves alone
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run and again, he's done his work for the over and so can leave deliveries in the channel outside off without a worry

Bollinger to PD Collingwood, 1 run well, Collingwood wasn't content to just play out the over! He charges down the track to the last ball and aims a massive heave over midwicket. Can't quite connect though, and the ball trickles behind square
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run driven firmly to cover
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run little bit of movement away through the air, Collingwood defends a very full ball somewhat awkwardly and the ball rolls into the off side
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run pushed behind square, but straight to backward point
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run slipping down towards leg stump, that was there to be hit but Collingwood couldn't lay bat on ball. Perhaps beaten slightly for pace as ball strikes pad
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run full on off, tapped back to the bowler
Harris to PD Collingwood, 1 run pushed just to the right of mid on, giving them opportunity for a quick single
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run wobbling around outside off, Collingwood is quite happy to leave alone

Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run big appeal from Bollinger as he shapes one back in to the right-hander to strike him on the pad. But it pitched just on leg, and was going way over the top of off, so an optimistic appeal.
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run pushed across Collingwood, who pulls his bat out of the way and leaves again
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, 1 run full and slightly wider, Collingwood tries a drive but isn't in a great position and the ball skews to cover
Bollinger to Morgan, no run back of a length outside off, rising nicely up to about chest height and Morgan leaves alone
Bollinger to Morgan, no run now he gets one to jag in to the left-hander off the seam, and the ball is tapped defensively to point with a hop
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run ball squirts off the inside edge, going to cover as it rebounds off the pad. Morgan wants a run but Collingwood sends him back. A direct hit would've had him there
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run pulls the length back a touch, and Collingwood pushes to cover
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run driven on the up, but again straight to cover
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run full and straight this time, Collingwood tries to nurdle to leg but finds mid-on
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run hmm, has that kept low? It was on a length outside off and Collingwood aimed to slash it away, but the ball zipped under the bat
Harris to PD Collingwood, 1 run tip-and-run to finish the over, as the ball is pushed into the tiniest of gaps at cover and they set off immediately for a single. Nice running
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, 1 run much fuller this time, prodded defensively to midwicket, and they take a quick single
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 wide left-hander messes up the radar as he spears one down the leg side
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 leg bye sharp yorker! Morgan is struck on the foot to cries of anguish from the Australian fielders, but that was slipping way down leg
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run back of a length and straight, Collingwood hops back and across to defend
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, 1 run full, and clipped out to deep midwicket. They briefly consider a second
Bollinger to Morgan, no run on a length, and coming in off the seam. Morgan responds with a solid forward defensive, presenting the full face of a straight bat
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run edged first ball! But that fell just short, and wide, of Watson at slip. Half a chance, but it didn't get to him.
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run nudged gently off the hip, and they charge through for one as Hopes sprints across after his follow-through
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run tapped easily to deep mid-on for an ambled single
Hopes to Morgan, no run a touch of movement away off the seam, but Morgan spots it and defends towards cover
Hopes to Morgan, no run Hopes pulls the length back slightly, and again the ball is pushed defensively to cover
Hopes to Morgan, 1 wide pushed too far down leg, that's a wide
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run tapped out to wide long-on for another easy single
Bollinger to Morgan, no run Bollinger bangs one in outside off, Morgan drops his hands and leaves

Bollinger to Morgan, 4 leg byes sharp bouncer! And perfectly directed, Morgan aimed to hook it up and over fine leg but took his eyes off the ball, which took the top edge and touched the shoulder and the bottom of the helmet, flying up an
Bollinger to Morgan, no run on a length, seaming in and tucked straight to midwicket
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run pushed just between midwicket and the wide mid-on, and they take a sharp single
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run driven to mid-off, but not timed
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run driven to mid-off once again, a slightly better connection but straight to the fielder
Hopes to Morgan, no run this is on a good length and line to welcome Morgan back after the break, defended to cover
Hopes to Morgan, FOUR runs lovely shot this, he's been very patient to begin with but now Morgan skips down the wicket, gives himself a bit of room and drives wristily through the covers for four
Hopes to Morgan, 2 runs follows up the boundary with a neat tickle round the corner for two more
Hopes to Morgan, no run this would keep the bowler interested, outside off stump and Morgan just let his hands follow the ball

Hopes to Morgan, OUT gone! What a catch! Morgan nailed a pull shot, smashing it flat towards a straightish midwicket, the Marsh in the deep ran round and dived, juggling the ball as he landed to clasp on to the catch
Hopes to Pietersen, no run bouncer to greet the new man, outside off and he leaves alone
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run tidy start, gentle spin away Collingwood defends
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run this time Collingwood turns it into the leg side to bring Pietersen on to strike
Smith to Pietersen, no run Pietersen has to stretch forward first ball, that thigh will get a severe working over
Smith to Pietersen, no run gets into a good position here, stretching forward and driving crisply to cover

Smith to Pietersen, OUT gone! Maybe that thigh won't get much of a testing then. It was short and slightly wide, Pietersen went back to cut but ends up with a bottom edge on to his foot which goes on to the stumps leaving England in a bit of
Smith to Wright, no run Wright defends with an inside edge
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run touch short, Collingwood aims to cut, but can't find any timing
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run much fuller this time, Collingwood pops forward to drive, but it skews off the inside half of the bat
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run hint of width this time, Collingwood tries to guide it to third man, but can't beat point
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run Hopes doing a fine job here, Collingwood can't beat the infield
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run once again nothing on offer for Collingwood, he defends quietly
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run back of a length to finish, Collingwood defends
Smith to Wright, 3 runs men at silly mid-off and slip, and so a huge gap at extra cover which Wright finds with a cracking drive. But there is a deep cover, and he cuts if off
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run driven to mid-off
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run full and flighted, Collingwood lunges forward to defend
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run very optimistic appeal from 'keeper and bowler as the ball strikes pad, but there was a massive inside edge on that
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run slashed but straight to backward point
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run punched out to deep cover for the single
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run Collingwood picks up a swift single pushing this full ball to mid on
Hopes to Wright, 1 run short and wide, feeding Wright's most comfortable stroke - the off side slash - but there is a deep point in place
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run suddenly this has a darkly familiar feeling for England, Australia dominant, Collingwood digging desperately
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run good save this, driven firmly but Hussey dives at short extra
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 2 runs gets this away though, pushing through point for a couple
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run fuller from Hopes and Collingwood's drive can't pierce the infield
Smith to Wright, no run big innings this for Wright, he hasn't batted well this series and has plenty of time to do so here, blocks this studiously off the front foot
Smith to Wright, 1 run picks out a single here, full-facing into the cover region
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run nicely milked down the ground by Collingwood
Smith to Wright, no run Wright is once again forward and defending. Even Tim Paine, the man with the world's most gentle face, seems to be having a fearful sledge
Smith to Wright, no run Wright is carefully forward and blocking
Smith to Wright, 1 run slashed hard into the point region, the pace is taken off by a fielder so it's only one
Hopes to Wright, no run Wright is doing his best Test batting impression, presenting a pendulum-straight bat
Hopes to Wright, no run this time Wright is defending off the back foot, and doing it very solidly
Hopes to Wright, no run Hopes is doing a great job, giving nothing away, Wright blocks
Hopes to Wright, 1 run England aren't really going anywhere here, this time it's short, Wright is back trying to find a big hook shot, but it top-edges meekly, one-bounce to fine leg
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run Collingwood is happy to push a single down the ground
Hopes to Wright, 1 run better from Wright, solidly forward but pushing past the bowler to milk one
Smith to Wright, 1 run single here nudged into the leg side
Smith to PD Collingwood, 2 runs Collingwood gets forward and pushes through extra cover
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run nothing on offer here, classic defence from Collingwood
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run nice played, skipping down the track and clipped away for a single in front of midwicket
Smith to Wright, 1 run calmly pushed down the ground for a single
Hopes to Wright, no run not much happening for the batsmen, maybe they should think about using the Powerplay, it worked wonders for Australia
Hopes to Wright, 1 run touch of width allows Wright to slap it through point but there is a fielder set deep
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run neatly blocked back to the bowler
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run ooh, big edge on this, but it was a slower ball and bounced a couple of times through to Paine
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood drives crisply but again finds a leaping and diving Hussey
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run single to finish the over, pushed towards mid on
Tait to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs easy pickings for Collingwood, pace on the ball, angled into the legs, Collingwood clips through straight midwicket for four
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run cranking up his pace a bit already, Collingwood aims a cut and it's through him before he can lay bat on ball
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run touch shorter and enough width outside off, left well alone
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run a play and a miss, full and asking for a drive, Collingwood answers the call but can't connect
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run it's a quieter start from Tait, the match tension has gone slightly, he bowled a four-over spell first up which may have tired him, still fairly rapid though

Tait to PD Collingwood, SIX runs Collingwood has fifty! Not sure how much he knew about it, banged in short from Tait, Collingwood on the hook, flies off a top edge all the way over the fine leg boundary
Hopes to Wright, no run big appeal from Hopes, though it was a touch, err, optimistic from him, thudding into the pads but heading down leg
Hopes to Wright, no run feeding Wright's cut shot, and it's played very well, but straight to the fielder at point
Hopes to Wright, no run pressure building on Wright, just finding the fielders a touch
Hopes to Wright, FOUR runs that'll help, again, not quite as planned, big pull shot aimed but it gets a top edge and sails over Paine for four

Hopes to Wright, 2 runs this is excellently played by Wright, really good shot, couple of steps down the wicket, gave himself a bit of room , but didn't try to overhit his cover drive, instead timing it nicely for a couple
Hopes to Wright, no run bouncer to finish the over, Wright crouches under it
Tait to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs he's been fearful so far today, but this time Tait dishes up a cuddly leg-stump slower-ball full toss that Collingwood clips for four round the corner
Tait to PD Collingwood, 1 run touch short and a touch wide, Collingwood cuts firmly, but deep point keeps it to one
Tait to Wright, no run he may not have the rhythm of his earlier spell, but still a decent pace being generated, Wright bottom-edges his attempted cut
Tait to Wright, no run good ball this, fuller and straighter and Wright defends
Tait to Wright, no run Tait is probably a little fortunate this wasn't called a wide, arrowed down the leg side
Tait to Wright, 2 runs full outside off stump, Wright drives through the covers for a couple
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 2 runs nicely done from Collingwood, doing an excellent Hussey impression by dinking it gently behind square on the leg side to run a couple
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run another leg-side nurdle here, tickled round the corner for one
Hopes to Wright, no run Wright meets a straight ball with a straighter bat
Hopes to Wright, no run Wright edges down the wicket, looking to manufacture something but Hopes is far too straight
Hopes to Wright, no run back of a length and Wright blocks firmly to point
Hopes to Wright, no run this will be frustrating for Wright, he skipped down the wicket and thumped Hopes straight to the mid off fielder
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run nicely bowled here, flighted and landing around leg stump, Collingwood blocks
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run Collingwood was down the track and missed an attempted leg-side clip Tim Paine tried to run round and flick it on to the stumps, missed and allowed an overthrow
Smith to Wright, 1 run Wright gets a single, sweeping carefully
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run massive appeal as Collingwood played back right in front of his stumps, the ball thudded into the pads but there was a faint inside edge
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run no alarm this time, just carefully picked though midwicket for one
Smith to Wright, no run Wright is forward and defending a touch uneasily
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 2 runs nicely ticked over by Collingwood here, clipping Hopes to leg gently enough to take a couple
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run nothing on offer here, defended to midwicket
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run this is a help-your-self single, pushed down the ground for one
Hopes to Wright, no run Hopes slips in a bouncer, Wright ducks underneath it
Hopes to Wright, 1 run Wright backs away a fraction and guides a drive through point for a quiet single
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run that'll do for Collingwood, pushing into a space at midwicket and running through for another single
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run tapped down to long-on for one

Smith to Wright, OUT Wright slogs sweeps and makes a good connection ... but Shaun Marsh charges round at deep midwicket to take his second superb running catch in the deep. He held this one much more cleanly, and as Smith picks up his secon
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run decent flight and turn from middle and leg, Collingwood stretches forward and defends to the leg side
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run pulled down too short but Collingwood can't capitalise, chopping straight to extra cover
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run punched to that man at extra cover once again
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run straight-driven hard, but straight back to the bowler
Hopes to Bresnan, 1 run slapped to backward point, where the fielder makes a tumbling stop but can't cut off the single, and Bresnan is off the mark
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run Colly aims a paddle-pull. Ball strikes glove, but goes into space at short fine leg, and they scamper through again

Hopes to Bresnan, FOUR runs genuine outside edge, flies wide of Paine - dropping infront of him too - and rolls down to third man. That was the slower legcutter from Hopes, and gripped quite nicely in the turf
Hopes to Bresnan, 1 run short ball from Hopes, Bresnan pulls but rolls his wrists on the shot to keep it down as he sends the ball out to deep midwicket
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood moves back and across and jabs to mid-off
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run too straight, and getting straighter with some movement off the seam, and Collingwood clips out to midwicket
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run tossed up invitingly, Collingwood takes a couple of steps down the track and sends the ball down to long-on
Smith to Bresnan, no run slightly slower through the air on off stump, Bresnan defends
Smith to Bresnan, 1 wide slips out the side of the hand and goes down the leg side, wide called
Smith to Bresnan, no run tapped softly into the covers
Smith to Bresnan, no run Bresnan stays deep in the crease and tries to steer the ball away square, but point scampers round to cut it off
Smith to Bresnan, 3 runs good shot as Bresnan backs away and carves infront of point, but a superb effort from Bollinger on the ropes saves a boundary
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run chipped just over and slightly wide of Hussey at straight midwicket, long-on runs round to cut the ball off
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run driven on the up through the covers
Hussey to Bresnan, 1 run tapped back down the wicket
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run driven to long-off this time, easy runs for England
Hussey to Bresnan, FOUR runs yeah, not too sure about this, Hussey drops short and Bresnan has no trouble rocking back and thumping a pull behind square to bring up the 150
Hussey to Bresnan, 1 run and of course, just as I say that Hussey finds the edge of the bat. Thick edge though, and Paine is up to the stumps so no chance to take it
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 wide flung well wide of the stumps, that's a huge wide
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run tapped easily down to long-on
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run Smith gives the ball a good twirl and lands it on middle and leg, Collingwood lunges out to defend
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run Colly dances down the track but can't get to the pitch and so defends
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run solid forward defensive stroke again
Smith to PD Collingwood, 2 runs nudged out behind square on the leg side, it wasn't hit too hard and was right between the men out there and so they scamper back for the second
Smith to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs a gift - full toss on leg stump - and Collingwood collects a boundary at wide midwicket with a bottom-handed shovel
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run driven straight to Ponting at cover
Hussey to Bresnan, 1 run low full toss outside off cracked down to long-off
Hussey to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs the gentlest of long-hops is dished up outside off and Collingwood gleefully hammers the ball through cover for four

Hussey to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs four more! Half-volley and Collingwood gets forward and across to hammer a cover drive through the gap at cover. Great shot, right out the middle, and the Hussey experiment really isn't working
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run pushed to long-off
Hussey to Bresnan, 1 run and again, by Bresnan this time, and another easy single
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run driven firmly on the up, but this time straight to the man on the edge of the circle at cover
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, 1 run back of a length, chopped out to deep cover

Bollinger to Bresnan, FOUR runs sliced four for Bresnan! The ball was short and wide and the cut was on, he found good placement and though Hopes slid across at the boundary he couldn't quite cut it off
Bollinger to Bresnan, no run punched back to the bowler
Bollinger to Bresnan, 1 run Bresnan picks up a single to third man
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood goes back and across to a back-of-a-length ball and defends to off
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run slower cutter, on a length and pushed back to the bowler
Harris to Bresnan, no run pushed straight to point off the back foot
Harris to Bresnan, no run and again, accurate stuff from Harris and Bresnan finds the man at point once more
Harris to Bresnan, no run full this time, and firmly driven by Bresnan but straight to mid-off
Harris to Bresnan, no run Harris errs in line, slipping a length ball down leg, but Bresnan can't get it away and ball strikes the thigh pad
Harris to Bresnan, FOUR runs resounding crack off the bat as Bresnan muscles a backfoot drive out to deep cover! And that's the fifty partnership!
Harris to Bresnan, 1 run flapped to mid-on
Bollinger to Bresnan, no run Bresnan is struck on the pad and Bollinger launches a huge appeal, but that pitched outside leg and was slipping even further down leg

Bollinger to Bresnan, 1 run pulled out to deep midwicket, there's some confusion in the running as Bresnan turns and sets off for the second with Collingwood motionless at the other end. But the throw goes to the wrong end, and he makes it h
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run chopped down close in on the off side, they think about stealing a single but Bollinger charges across to collect the ball
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, 1 run driven to a deep-ish mid-off, they scamper a single
Bollinger to Bresnan, no run huge, airy swipe outside off, and Bresnan is lucky not to get an edge on that
Bollinger to Bresnan, no run half-volley wide of off but Bresnan can't make anything of it, driving straight to mid-off. The fielder was deep, but he hit it too hard to allow a single
Harris to PD Collingwood, 1 run nudged to midwicket, and they set off for a single
Harris to Bresnan, FOUR runs what a shot! Bresnan hammers a drive up and over cover, and gets four! It wasn't a half-volley by any means, but he absolutely hammered that
Harris to Bresnan, 1 run clipped infront of square on the leg side
Harris to PD Collingwood, 1 run pushed down to long-on
Harris to Bresnan, 1 run low full toss driven hard to long-off
Harris to PD Collingwood, 1 run chopped hard into the ground infront of square, they scamper a single
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run ooh, he looks a bit stiff, unleashed a massive grunt as he delivered into Collingwood's pads
Tait to PD Collingwood, 1 run touch of reverse for Tait, spearing it in full from wide of the crease, Collingwood bunts it for a single to midwicket
Tait to Bresnan, no run Bresnan has the eager look of a man stretching beyond his competence, doing very well here and blocks Tait carefully into the off side

Tait to Bresnan, OUT Ponting strikes! Brilliant from the Australian captain! Bresnan pushed towards him and set off for one, Ponting collected, spun and threw at the non-striker's end, direct hit has Bresnan miles short. Big strike that, sho
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run back of a length and cut firmly to point

Tait to PD Collingwood, OUT over and out! Tait strikes! Stumps clattered! Collingwood advanced down the track, bit of inswing beats the batsman and uproots the leg stump. Defiant knock from Collingwood, but all over now.
Smith to Swann, 2 runs Swann off the mark, tickling a sweep round the corner for a couple
Smith to Swann, 2 runs nicely played by Swann, touch of width allows a neat back-cut, beating short third man and running away for a couple
Smith to Swann, no run haha, well, Swann lined up for a switch hit very early, no Smith shoved down a bouncer, which beat Swann and he almost ended up stumped
Smith to Swann, 1 run less incident here, just driven firmly down the ground for a single
Smith to Broad, no run Broad stretches forward and defends carefully
Smith to Broad, 1 run touch fuller from Smith, Broad leans forward, works a single to midwicket to bring up the 200
Tait to Broad, no run Broad looks a world of uncertainty at the crease these days, backing away, edging into line and fencing at a ball outside off stump
Tait to Broad, no run once again Broad backs away a fraction, Tait fires in a yorker and Broad manages to jab a bat down just in time
Tait to Broad, 1 run once again Broad gives himself room and then ends up with a distinctly tailender looking prod into the cover region for one
Tait to Swann, no run ooh, this only missed by a fraction, it was full, very fast and swinging in late to Swann, narrowly missing off stump
Tait to Swann, 1 run Swann more comfortable here, nudging to square leg for a single
Tait to Broad, no run great stuff from Tait, this was banged in short and climbed, honing into Broad's face, he managed to get a bat in the way just in time
Smith to Swann, 2 runs Swann is forward and pushing a couple towards long on
Smith to Swann, no run nicely bowled, a touch slower and loopier, Swann played a sweep but missed
Smith to Swann, 2 runs bunted into the leg side again for a couple in front of square, neatly played
Smith to Swann, FOUR runs excellent shot this, Swann switched hands very early and nailed the hit through what became midwicket, really top shot
Smith to Swann, 2 runs touch shorter and allows Swann to get back and cut firmly, picks up two more to deep point
Smith to Swann, FOUR runs and again! Quality switch-hit this, picking the gap in front of deep cover and timing the shot superbly
Harris to Broad, 1 run Broad doesn't quite manage one of his handsome off-side drives and instead gets an mistimed single
Harris to Swann, FOUR runs very nicely done from Swann, was a gentle delivery, full toss, but Swann moved across his stumps and clipped it past the short fine leg for four
Harris to Swann, no run nicely bowled from Harris, Swann was backing away looking for a shot over cover, Harris followed him and cramped him entirely
Harris to Swann, FOUR runs four more! Swann picked the slower ball, waited and waited and then swung in between mid on and midwicket for four
Harris to Swann, FOUR runs and again! Swann still believes, and why not!? Full toss crashed straight back over the bowler's head for four more
Harris to Swann, no run nothing here for Swann, he backed away but Harris was good at following him and landing it full, cramping any room and Swann couldn't connect

Bollinger to Broad, OUT Duggie has done it! Terrific caught and bowled! Broad mistimed a check-drive back down the wicket, Bollinger stuck out a hand and found the ball in it! That should finally settle this game
Bollinger to Anderson, no run Anderson needs a single, but won't find one here, yorker and dug out back to the bowler
Bollinger to Anderson, 1 run short and wide, Anderson flapped an upper-cut down one-bounce to Harris at third man. Swann back on strike
Bollinger to Swann, 1 run Swann shuffled down the wicket and outside leg, Bollinger shoved it in short and followed him, in the end Swann could only wheel a pull shot away for one to fine leg

Bollinger to Anderson, FOUR runs Anderson this time finds his a boundary, which is fairly unlikely, it was a full toss, Anderson gave himself some room and landed a rather stylish drive through the covers for four
Bollinger to Anderson, no run short and Anderson was looking to find an upper-cut but it whistled past him
Tait to Swann, no run Swann has Tait to deal with, who bangs in a short ball, Swann had backed away outside leg and missed his swipe
Tait to Swann, no run touch too swift for Swann that, banged in short and zipping past Swann's neck as the batsman tried to swish it away

Tait to Swann, OUT that'll be all! Tait finishes it off, which is apt, with a slower ball, which isn't! Swann backed away and tried to carve it over mid off but he couldn't time it and ended up gifting a catch to mid off.
That's about it from us. There is of course plenty more cricket going around and Australia are back in action against Pakistan on Monday.
Eoin Morgan is man of the series. Like Tait he's a man of few words but says, somewhat predictably, that he would was disappointed not to contribute more in England's last two games.

Shaun Tait is named man of the match he really deserved it. From his interview he looks like a man with more pace than words and is surprisingly soft-spoken. He too has none of Atherton's invitation to turn his Test retirement around, saying he str
Michael Atherton leads the presentation ceremony. Ponting dead-bats Atherton's invitation to speculate about Tait's Test future and rightly praises his side for coming back so strongly in the series.
Brydon will have his bulletin ready for you soon, so check that out. And for the visually minded we have a gallery of the best of the day's action.
England do of course take the series, but ahead of the Ashes there was enough for both teams to take with them to Brisbane.

Australia have come back very strongly from 3-0 down - they've beaten England comfortably in the last two games. It was Mike Hussey and Shaun Marsh's partnership that first turned the game towards Australia, but Shaun Tait nailed home the advantage
Australia won by 42 runs
Player of the match is Shaun Tait, AUS
